name: Ningning Xie
content: Ningning Xie Ningning Xie Assistant Professor Department of Computer Science University of Toronto Research Scientist, Google DeepMind Faculty Affiliate, Schwartz Reisman Institute Office: BA 3256 Email: ningningxie at cs.toronto.edu [CV] About I am an Assistant Professor in the Department of Computer Science at the University of Toronto. My research focuses on programming languages, in particular functional programming, type systems, logics, as well as their applications in broader domains. Previously, I was a Research Scientist at Google DeepMind, where I currently hold a part-time position, and a Research Associate at the University of Cambridge. I received my Ph.D. from the University of Hong Kong, and my B.S. from Zhejiang University. Prospective students: I always look for motivated students to join my group. Please take a look at this link. News Two papers accepted at POPL'26. I gave an invited keynote at HOPE'25. I'm co-chairing PEPM'26. Please consider submitting a paper! We received a Distinguished Paper Award for our ICFP'25 paper. I serve as the Publicity Chair for POPL'26 . I'm co-chairing Haskell'25, please consider submitting a paper and/or a talk proposal! One paper accepted at ICFP'25. I'm co-organizing PLMW@ICFP/SPLASH'25. We received a Distinguished Paper Award at PLDI'25.
